title: LIMNAIE
content:
LIMNAIE (Limnaee) was the Naiad-nymph of a lake in India, a daughter of the river Ganges. Her son Atthis was
        slain by the hero Perseus in the court of King Kepheus (Cepheus) of Aithiopia (Ethiopia)--he was presumably a
        suitor of Andromeda.

Ovid, Metamorphoses 5. 47 ff (trans. Melville) (Roman epic C1st B.C. to C1st A.D.)
          :
        "[In the court of King Cepheus of Aethiopia :] There was an Indian lad, Atthis, whom Ganges' daughter,
        Limnaee, bore beneath her crystal waters. His fine looks were striking and enhanced by rich attire. [Atthis was
        slain by Perseus in the fight with Phineus for Andromeda.]"

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
